us.phonetic: /n. ˈkɑmpləmənt; v. ˈkɑmpləˌmɛnt/, (n. kom′plə mənt; v. kom′plə ment′)

example.eg: The decor complements the architecture of the building perfectly.
example.egtrans: 大楼的装潢完美地衬托了其建筑风格。

example.eg: During the strike, the school had to open without its full complement of teachers.
example.egtrans: 在教师罢工期间，学校不得不在有教师缺席的情况下开学。

example.eg: The complement of orange is blue.

us.phonetic: /n. ˈkɑmpləmənt; v. ˈkɑmpləˌmɛnt/, (n. kom′plə mənt; v. kom′plə ment′)

example.eg: This Chardonnay is the perfect complement to tuna.
example.egtrans: 这瓶霞多丽酒是吞拿鱼理想的配餐。

example.eg: Adjuncts are optional in grammar, but complements are required.
The ship's complement includes twenty officers.

us.phonetic: /n. ˈkɑmpləmənt; v. ˈkɑmpləˌmɛnt/, (n. kom′plə mənt; v. kom′plə ment′)

example.eg: Liz and Brian are very different, but as a couple, they complement one another.
